_comment: Created by ianb on 27/06/2014 16:15:02 using v2.1
title: How has the percentage of successful quitters changed by quarter?
analysis_commentary: Up to 2008, the quarterly reports on smoking quitters showed a strong seasonal pattern with the highest rate of quitters in quarter 4, which covers January to March. This peak showed a higher rate of people quitting at the start of each year, suggesting that seasonal motivation is having a big impact on the proportion of quitters. However, since 2011 quarter 1, this trend hasn't been as pronounced with the proportion of quitters steadily increasing in all quarters since then. This had improved to 53.1% in 2012 quarter 4. In seems in terms of giving up smoking, New Years resolutions arenâ€™t what they were.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Statistics on NHS Stop Smoking Services in England
